getObjectChat
This function returns an object chat (an instance of the MessengerChat class).
Syntax
getObjectChat
(objId)
Setting
Purpose
objId
Instance of the object (its ID) on which the chat was created.
Note
The function is called from the
"Messages" tab
toolbar of the algorithm editor.
When calling a function, a function with a dummy variable
objId
is added to the algorithm code, which should be replaced with the required value.
Use example
For example, suppose there is an object chat in which user roles need to be customized.
The algorithm can be as follows:
Getting a current object chat is done using the
getObjectChat
function.
Other functions were also used to create this algorithm.
More
A new variable “chat” is declared using the function
var
.
The current object is specified using the
currentObject
function.
The user is selected by using the
dict
function and selecting the required object of “User” type.
To assign the administrator role to Smith S., the
setChatUserAdmin
function  is used.
To assign the reader role to Johnson J., the
setChatUserRights
function is used.
